item.title: Final Fantasy 7 Remake Will Be Close to 100GB on Switch 2
item.content:encoded:
Final Fantasy 7 Remake Intergrade’s storage requirements have been changed for the Nintendo Switch 2, now coming in close to 100GB.

We have been hearing a lot about Final Fantasy 7 Remake Part 3 recently, with devs stating they are considering a whole new game after the release of the final part. However, in the meantime, development on FF7 Remake Intergrade continues for Switch 2, and it seems the game will take up almost half of Switch 2’s base storage space.

Final Fantasy 7 Remake Will Take Up Almost Half of Switch 2’s Storage Space

The announcement about changes towards Final Fantasy 7 Remake Intergrade 2’s storage size on the Switch 2 was revealed through a new official post on X (formerly Twitter). The standard edition of the title will now range from 90GB to 95GB, up from the previously announced 87.8GB. The Limited Early Purchase Edition and the Limited Early Purchase Digital Deluxe Edition will be priced between 93.8GB and 99GB. These changes will reflect on the Nintendo Store pages soon.

Final Fantasy 7 Remake Intergrade will release for the Switch 2 on January 22, 2026, where players adventure with Avalanche, a ragtag group of idealists who aim to protect the planet. The game follows the story of Cloud Strife, a former soldier turned mercenary who has joined Avalanche to blow up Reactor 1. This edition also includes FF7R EPISODE INTERmission, where players get to play as Yuffie Kisaragi, a young ninja from Wutai, as she infiltrates Midgar on a mission to steal the ultimate materia from the Shinra Electric Power Company.

In other news, Final Fantasy 9 Remake might be ‘on ice‘ according to information shared by a reliable insider. Additionally, FF7 Remake Trilogy has been officially confirmed for Xbox and Switch 2. item.title: Reanimal Release Date Confirmed
item.content:encoded:
Reanimal is releasing on February 13, 2026, for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, PC, and Switch 2.

Tarsier Studios announced their upcoming title, Reanimal, at Gamescom Opening Night earlier this year, with a trailer that got many players excited. The developers are also experienced in this space, bringing players the first two Little Nightmare games and LittleBigPlanet 3.

Reanimal Release Date Set for February 13, 2026; Pre-Orders Are Live

The release date for Reanimal was spotted by Shinobi602 on X (formerly Twitter). The release date announcement also comes with other news: first, the PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X/S demos for the title will go live today. Secondly, pre-orders for Reanimal are live as well, with the bonus being exclusive Foxhead & Muttonhead masks. Digital Deluxe edition buyers will get a Season Pass for all 3 DLC chapters along with the pre-order bonus.

Reanimal is a co-op horror-adventure where players experience the story of a brother and sister who set foot in hell to save their friends. The region the players explore is filled with tension and a thick atmosphere as they traverse by boat and on land. Exploration is key, as the main path is only one part of the story, with many mysterious locations and their own stories to tell. The title is fully playable in single player and local & online co-op, it also has “a shared, directed camera, designed to maximise claustrophobia and tension.”

In other news, read this guide to know whether you need to play Little Nightmares 1 and 2 before playing the third part. What are your thoughts on Reanimal’s release date and pre-order bonus? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Battlefield 6 Was the US’s Best-Selling Game of October 2025
item.content:encoded:
The latest video game sales data has been released for October 2025, and it should come as no surprise that Battlefield 6 was the best-selling game for the month.

According to the latest sales data from Circana, Battlefield 6 takes the top spot away from Borderlands 4, which fell down to number 10.

Looking at the rest of the top five games, Pokémon Legends Z-A came in second followed by Ghost of Yotei, NBA 2K26, and EA Sports FC 26 at No. 3-5, respectively. When going through the full top 20 for the month, five games were new releases with The Outer Worlds 2, Little Nightmares 3, and Ninja Gaiden 4 joining the aforementioned Battlefield 6 and Pokémon Legends Z-A.

You can check out the full list of the best-selling games for October 2025 below and be sure to leave your thoughts on Battlefield 6 being the top game for the month down in the comments below. And don’t forget to join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.
